history.text: The Avengers is a great movie, huh guys?
Yes it was, i really enjoyed it
Critics seemed to like it too, it has a really high Rotten Tomatoes score.
I wonder why Metacritic only rated the movie 69/100
I'm not sure. Who was you're favorite actor? I really like Robert Downey Jr.
I am a big fan of Samuel L. Jackson myself.  He is a perfect fit for the Nick Fury role.
Oh yeah, he was really good too. Did you like anyone else?
I like Chris Evans as well.  He is a great actor.
Yes, he was good as Captain America. What did you think about Mark Ruffalo's take on The Hulk?
Personally I did not enjoy his adaptation of the Hulk character.  I know that he is just the revelation of the hulk though.  How about those CGI graphics though? Pretty cool huh?

Yes, they were really good. What did you think of the scene at the beginning
, when Loki shows up?
That was a good lead in to the ensuing plot.
Yes, and there is a lot of action with them taking the Tesseract and controlling Hawkeye.
I wish I knew more about the characters' back stories prior to seeing the film.
Well, it is the sixth film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, so you should go back and watch the other five if you're curious.

That is true. I am sure that if I watched the Thor movies, I would have a better understanding.  I'
ve only seen the Ironman and Captain America movies.  Which ones have you seen?
I've seen them all actually. Really good and makes The Avengers better. What did you think of the part of the movie where Loki splits the team up and they begin fighting with each other?
I thought that was a really good twist in the action; turning friends into enemies.  I liked how Ironman found himself in the middle of the whole conflict.  He was a very dynamic character
Yeah it was interesting seeing The Hulk fighting with Thor.
What did you think of Iron Man and Captain America working together to fix the damaged engine?
that was a good exchange between the two actors.  they are a dynamic duo those two.
What about when Loki escapes and kills Coulson? That was sad, huh?
I definitely did not see that one coming.
I think it is cool how Marvel goes from fantasy science fiction locations to real life locations like New York City and blends the two entities.

Oh yeah that is really cool. Strange that they always use New York though. But also, I liked how they used Coulson's death to bring the group back together and motivate them to fight of Lokie and Chitauri.
That is a good point.  I believe the fictional Stark Tower is located in NYC.  That is where Loki used the Tesseract with the other device to open up that wormhole above Stark Tower.
It was funny when Hulk grabbed Loki and beat him up, right?
yes that was pretty humorous
Also, what did you think about the part where Iron Man grabs the missile and takes it into space?
That was really cool.  I especially enjoyed how the Hulk rescued Iron Man from crashing into the ground.
Yes, that showed more teamwork. And of course that meant The Avengers saved the day and would return when they were needed again. Great movie right?
Great movie indeed!
